page.title: 13An Anstonian Remembers
page.content: {Mrs.Butterfield}was born in Anston and used to live on{The Baulk}then{Main {Street.}There wasn't any piped water then so they had to take containers to the{Town Wells.}Shallow troughs are there with spring water in them. There was no electricity in the houses. There were a lot of farms with dairy cattle,pigs and sheep. It was a common sight to see cows walking along narrow roads from the fields to be milked. Cattle were watered at Townend pond on {Quarry Lane.}Anston Brook stream was used as a sheep dip. Corn was taken by cart to the farmyard from the fields.A thrashing machine separated the corn from the stalks. Cows were walked to Worksop to the cattle market.On{Penny {Piece Lane}there were Starch houses. They sold starch,nails and whitewash. On{Mill Lane}there used to be a steam mill that ground corn into flour.
